intro: Chaerophyllum meoides, commonly known as the meadow bellflower, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes many aromatic plants such as carrots and parsley. The plant features finely divided, fern-like leaves and produces small, clustered white or pale yellow flowers. It typically grows in moist meadows and along streambanks, preferring well-drained soil. Its botanical characteristics make it an attractive addition to native plant gardens and ecological restoration projects.
